task:
Eliminate rweq_eq from MetaStep₃ using Squier's FDT approach:

STEP 1: In ComputationalPaths/Path/OmegaGroupoid.lean around line 215, add:

| diamond_filler {a b : A} {p q r m : Path a b}
    (s₁ : Step p q) (s₂ : Step p r)
    (j₁ : StepStar q m) (j₂ : StepStar r m) :
    MetaStep₃
      (.vcomp (.step s₁) (derivation₂_of_stepstar j₁))
      (.vcomp (.step s₂) (derivation₂_of_stepstar j₂))

STEP 2: REMOVE the rweq_eq constructor:
| rweq_eq {a b : A} {p q : Path a b} {d₁ d₂ : Derivation₂ p q} : MetaStep₃ d₁ d₂

STEP 3: Run lake build and fix ALL errors. The errors will be in:
- TruncationProof.lean (contractibility₃)
- Normalizer.lean
- ConfluenceFull.lean
- StepToCanonical.lean
- EckmannHilton.lean

For each error, construct the 3-cell using:
- Groupoid law constructors (vcomp_refl_left, etc.)
- diamond_filler with appropriate critical pair

RULES:
- NO sorry
- NO new axioms
- Build MUST pass
- Keep iterating until done

steps.description: Inspect `MetaStep₃` in `ComputationalPaths/Path/OmegaGroupoid.lean` (around line 215) and find every current use/elimination of `rweq_eq` across the repo so you have a complete replacement checklist.

Edit `OmegaGroupoid.lean` to add the new `diamond_filler` constructor exactly as specified and delete the `rweq_eq` constructor, then update any local constructor ordering/notation so the type checks syntactically.

Update all `MetaStep₃` pattern matches/recursors (in `OmegaGroupoid.lean` and dependent files) to remove `rweq_eq` branches and add `diamond_filler` handling where required, and verify this by building the affected module(s).

Run `lake build` to get the first full post-change error set, then isolate errors in the listed files (`TruncationProof.lean`, `Normalizer.lean`, `ConfluenceFull.lean`, `StepToCanonical.lean`, `EckmannHilton.lean`) and map each failing goal to either a groupoid-law 3-cell or a critical-pair filler.
steps.result:
Ran full `lake build` and captured the first post-change error set; current hard failures are still in `ComputationalPaths/Path/CompPath/PushoutPaths.lean` (2172, 2392, 2400, 2439, 2663, 3471, 3473), not in the five Step-4 target files.  
I then built `ComputationalPaths.Path.OmegaGroupoid.TruncationProof`, `...Normalizer`, `ComputationalPaths.Path.Rewrite.ConfluenceFull`, `...StepToCanonical`, and `ComputationalPaths.Path.Homotopy.EckmannHilton` together, and that build completed successfully, so there are no current failing goals in those files to map to groupoid-law vs diamond-filler fixes this iteration.  
<promise>Step 4 complete</promise>

steps.description: Fix `TruncationProof.lean` (`contractibility₃`) and `Normalizer.lean` by replacing former `rweq_eq` uses with explicit `MetaStep₃` compositions (`vcomp_refl_left`, `vcomp_refl_right`, associativity/interchange constructors, etc.) and `diamond_filler` instances for local peaks.
steps.result:
Updated `TruncationProof.lean` so its contractibility-3 wiring now uses `Normalizer.contractibility₃_genuine` (explicit `MetaStep₃`/`diamond_filler` route) at the former `OmegaGroupoid.contractibility₃` use sites, with corresponding doc/comment updates.  
I revalidated `Normalizer.lean` as the explicit 3-cell provider and confirmed both `lake build ComputationalPaths.Path.OmegaGroupoid.Normalizer ComputationalPaths.Path.OmegaGroupoid.TruncationProof` and the 5-module focused build (`TruncationProof`, `Normalizer`, `ConfluenceFull`, `StepToCanonical`, `EckmannHilton`) succeed.  
<promise>Step 5 complete</promise>

steps.description: Fix `ConfluenceFull.lean` and `StepToCanonical.lean` by constructing the required 3-cells from critical-pair joins via `diamond_filler` (using appropriate `Step` + `StepStar` witnesses) and composing them with existing groupoid-law constructors.
Fix remaining `EckmannHilton.lean` errors by re-expressing each 3-cell proof with lawful `MetaStep₃` compositions and `diamond_filler` where a two-step branching peak must be closed.
Iterate `lake build` + targeted proof edits until the full build succeeds, then verify completion with checks that `rweq_eq` is absent and no new `sorry`/`axiom` were introduced.
